page.title: 18GT. WAKERINGS VEGETATION
page.content: WILD FLOWERS AND GRASSES ARE FOUND IN AND AROUND GREAT WAKERING. IN THE SUMMER MONTHS THE VERGES ARE ABLAZE , WITH COLOUR. SOME OF THE MOST COMMON FLOWERS TO BE SEEN ARE :- COMMON MALLOW, POPPIES, COMMON COMFREY, BINDWEED, DANDELION, HAWKWEED,COW PARSLEY AND MANY OTHERS. THE FOLLOWING PLANTS HAVE BEEN FOUND IN THIS AREA RECENTLY AND ARE VERY RARE TO GREAT WAKERING AND SOME ARE RARE TO THE COUNTRY AS A WHOLE:- TUBEROUS PEA, HAIRY VETCHLING, FODDER VETCH, YELLOW VETCHLING AND DIVIDED SEDGE. THERE ORCHIDS TO BE FOUND IN THIS AREA AND ALTHOUGH NOT EXACTLY RARE ARE A PROTECTED SPECIES.
